meanings.definition: The action of predestining or foreordaining something.
meanings.sent1: The preordination of events was believed to be set in stone.
meanings.sent2: Her preordination to become a doctor was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The preordination of winning the lottery seemed like a far-fetched dream.
meanings.sent4: The preordination of success in life can sometimes be influenced by hard work.
meanings.sent5: The preordination of the sunrise each morning is a beautiful natural occurrence.

meanings.definition: The state of being predestined or foreordained.
meanings.sent1: His acceptance of his preordination in life brought him peace.
meanings.sent2: The preordination of their meeting seemed like fate.
meanings.sent3: The preordination of always being late to work became a running joke.
meanings.sent4: The preordination of the seasons changing reminds us of the cycle of life.
meanings.sent5: The preordination of the stars in the night sky is a mesmerizing sight.
